They left the door unlocked for us, which made me feel very uncomfortable because someone could have been in there since we were planning to arrive very late. It was raining and there was nothing to pick up water with. The first night we all had to sleep uncomfortably on a small bed because I wasn't told until the next day where the air mattress was. Honestly the listing is more comfortable for 2 people but not more than that in my opinion, its very small. The host does not allow smoking, which is fine, we didnt smoke anywhere near the property.
Other than that the location is pretty good and the unit was clean.

I had one issue with batteries and Monica responded within seconds and resolved the issue which to me was not a really an issue but still I was very pleased at the fast response and proactive that was taken for batteries for the remote. My noise machine broke and I was pleasantly surprised to find box fans! I was able to cook and unwind everyday of my stay. The home made this stressful trip a place of peace for me. Thank you Monica.

Stayed with a pet
review_text: Most all of the airbnb rentals I've stayed in are smaller than they look in the pictures. This is the first time an airbnb was larger than it looked in the pictures. It felt spacious and comfortable. It's not huge but the space is laid out so well. This is also one of the cleanest airbnb rentals I've had the pleasure of staying at. For a pet friendly house on the coast, it was miraculously clean! I didn't see a grain of sand anywhere. The backyard was also much larger than I expected. Between the tall privacy fence, the picnic table, hammock, and a few trees-- it felt tranquil and inviting. We were two adults and two pups and we all loved the accommodations. I was ready to move in! It's the epitome of why I prefer homes over hotels--a kitchen with a fridge and dishwasher, washer and dryer, private backyard, closet space, and cold AC. Monica added the special touches with coffee and snacks! <3

It was also quite nice to be able for our family of five spread out over the two bedrooms and the main room, instead of all being crammed into a single hotel room.
One more additional thing was the flexible check-in. We were traveling from a great distance, and adding in time every time we stopped. Being allowed to check in when we got there without having to endure a hotel reception desk was fantastic! Using a code instead of a key was super-helpful, too!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Condo was super clean. Overall, it was a decent stay for the short time I was there.
Kitchen was very well stocked with cutlery and other needed items for eating and cooking.
Lots of storage/closet space so very good for longer stays or business traveling like I was doing. I was able to hang up what I needed to.
AC doesn't cool very quickly and it was over 80 degrees when I arrived late Saturday afternoon. It took quite a long time to cool down so I could relax and sleep.
Be sure you bring your own bath towels! The ones provided are super small and a size 2 can use them but no one larger.
No covered parking and lots of construction going on in the complex so there was limited parking available...especially with no reserved space for the unit. Coming and going was definitely difficult and construction isn't something I would've chosen to deal with, had I known ahead of time.

review_text: This place is perfect. Host is very responsive and helpful. Location and views can't be beat. The beach is right out the patio door. A few steps down the concrete water barrier and you are in the sand. The walkway right out the patio is nice to walk in the morning or at sunset as well. We had a bonfire on the beach one night which was great. Condo has a shared pool and hot tub as well. Kitchen has everything needed. Rooms and beds were clean and very comfortable beds. Our toddler loved the toys and fort building couch. Turntable with a good selection of vinyls is a nice touch too! we had a great time. I don't think you could find a much better place to stay on Padre Island than here. We would definitely come back.

It was a tranquil time of year, and the privacy was great for a peaceful stay. The only unexpected adventure was the mosquitos. They were out in full force as my morning run as I got bombarded, and they were so bad in the evening that we couldn't sit outside to enjoy the view. Of course, this is mother nature, and by no means controllable by the host, it was just bad timing for us. Overall, it was a great experience.

There are a lot of people walking around on the path outside the condo and on the beach.
Colleen was always very responsive and provided a really wonderful wine and charcuterie gift upon our arrival. The polaroid was fun and made us want to get our own. There were also plenty of games and puzzles to play inside.
I would have no hesitation in recommending this place for your visit to the beach.

review_text: Colleen’s condo is truly such a gem. Wonderful views, beautiful decorated and well stocked with everything we needed to keep the kids entertained inside and out. The beach itself was a little disappointing, which is certainly no fault of Colleen’s. There is a steep concrete “stair”/barrier to get down to the actual water, and the water often crashed right up against it so it wasn’t easy to walk on the beach with toes in the sand. Also, I’ve never been to such a trashed up beach. It was depressing. Again, none of this is Colleen’s fault, but I think it should be known that there is a steep, difficult concrete stair barrier between the condo and the water.

review_text: Awesome views! Has everything you need! Nicely put together house booklet (local info, instructions, etc) Record player was a nice bonus for me! Our family of 5 enjoyed our beach time every day and it was so great to be able to walk across the grass and sidewalk and step down the sea wall to the beach. Also allows for easy retrieval of chairs, canopy, games, etc from the condo. Great location and the beach is borderline private for the Island House community since vehicles cannot park in the section behind the building and that stretches down to the left (north) for a good bit. And you can just take a short walk that direction and set up camp there if you want to be by yourself on the beach. We also grill some nights on vacation and the Island House has a nice setup with 5 grills close to the pool that were recently updated and cleaned daily by the staff. Lastly, great communication from Colleen! Thanks for everything!

review_text: The Oceanfront Dreamweaver is a wonderful place to stay. We would absolutely stay there again. It is super clean, the beds and bedding are very comfortable. It is very spacious with a tremendous view. Being a corner unit gives you and enormous view and 4 patio chairs gave you plenty of places to just sit and relax. The papasan chair look so cute and are very comfortable for reading or napping. The beach is right outside the slider doors. The kitchen and bathrooms are supplied with everything you need. My daughters loved the record player and the snacks and movies available from the front desk. The swimming pool is wonderfully warm and clean. The condominium staff are very friendly and helpful.

review_text: Colleen's condo was perfection. It doesn't get any better for a family vacation. The location and view was spectacular. The corner condo unit is on a small section of beach closed to traffic. So great for our family getaway. We could just slide open the door and the kids could run outside! Plus there was a lovely heated pool in the complex which we used daily as well. Colleen also supplied everything you needed to make the most of the beach, chairs, umbrella, plenty of towels, etc. There's super comfy patio furniture and hose for cleaning off before coming inside which was very convenient. So many thoughtful touches inside the apartment, from s'mores ingredients, extra toiletries, welcome snacks, games, vinyl records, and of course plush towels and linens. We literally didn't leave our condo for 5 days it was so wonderful.

name: Dalan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Karl was just awesome! Super friendly and very accommodating. Karl just went above and beyond at every turn. The facilities were very private and the inside of the casita had hand crafted cypress cabinets and terracotta tile throughout. The whole compound was surrounded by a mid-height stucco wall and the grounds were beyond elegant.
We were in corpus to fish and towed a double jetski trailer. Karl let us flush our skis daily. We felt completely safe leaving our gear on our crafts overnight. The last morning we fished right of the backyard and caught 3 reds and 3 trout. One trout was 27 inches!!
To those potential renters you will absolutely love this place. Please, as a word of caution, take care of how you treat this place. Clean up after yourself. Don’t abuse this beautiful place. This is Karl’s home and he intentionally and willfully goes out of his way to make it feel like it is yours as well. God bless you Karl and thanks for your hospitality and friendship. God speed brother.

,

Stayed with kids
review_text: This place was a great getaway for our family. The bed was very comfortable! There were plenty of linens and towels for use. Lots of bathroom items in case you forgot something. Kitchen had lots of cooking utensils. We appreciated having a washer and dryer handy. The patio area was great, my husband loves fishing and really enjoyed being able to cast right off the back porch. The only drawback is that it is located right next to a bar and grille that plays live music. We enjoyed the music actually we just were hoping for a little more privacy. We did bring a sound machine for our 2 year old son and did not notice the noise once we went to bed but I’m sure without the sound machine we would have heard the music. Lisa was very responsive with any questions we had. I felt it was a good value for the area. There was a beach right by the airbnb but we opted to drive a little further out and enjoy padre island national seashore which was much less crowded. We had a great time!

review_text:
My friend and I had a lovely stay at the bungalow! It was cozy and inviting and made my first stay in Corpus Christi so cozy. By far, what I enjoyed the most about this home was its location. The neighborhood is wonderful and you can easily walk to the pier which we did.
This location is filled with charm.
As a believer, it was also wonderful to see that they had left a Bible for us to take.
In the evening, you’ll want to make sure the AC fan is on cool and set where the air flow is the highest. We did wake up feeling a bit stuffy in the bedroom (as it felt the air didn’t reach there) but as soon as we adjusted the air con we were able to sleep better.
Otherwise the bed itself was very comfortable.
Thank you for a wonderful stay!

,

Stayed one night
review_text:
Larry and Beth were accommodating and friendly. They opened their home with love and good tidings. Their home was beautifully decorated, nice and clean, and in a good area, minutes away from the beach. I was fortunate to eat at Hester’s diner, which was delicious and offered a healthy variety of meals.
Their garden and animals helped create an atmosphere that was safe and inviting. It was inspiring to see the past diary log of each persons stay and to include my own. Would recommend this beach bungalow to anyone!
I loved how Larry and Beth gave me a cute note with a Bible to share the good news about the gospel. It is wonderful to see fellow Christian’s sharing the love.
Jesus said…
“My command is this: love each other as I have loved you."
John 15:12
Thank you Larry and Beth for your accommodations and prayers!

name: Rebecca

May 2022
,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I’m so happy my friend and I chose to stay at Larry & Beth’s bungalow. We’ve always stayed at hotels and although they are very nice, we loved the comfy vibe of staying at the bungalow. It was peaceful and just a few blocks from the water.
We appreciated receiving a bible as a gift and thought it was no coincidence we chose the bungalow, because one of our purposes for our trip was to pray over the city of Corpus Christi.
When I return here I’d definitely stay at the bungalow again. I loved the water pressure too! I have very thick hair and that can make or break my trip… especially if it involves the beach!
The bungalow was the perfect size for me and my friend and I did bring an air mattress for me which fit perfectly in the living area.
I love how close the bungalow was to everything and that McGee Beach was right there because that’s the only beach cars aren’t driven on and that was very important to me.
When I text Beth she was quick to respond and she has a great sense of humor! Thanks for being amazing hosts Larry & Beth!

review_text:
Check-in and out was quite easy and Amanda was very communicative. The unit was super clean and tidy and also looked just like the pictures.
The only downside is that the unit was quite bare bones. We ended up eating out way more than we anticipated because the kitchen didn't really have enough accessories to cook much at all. This might be fine for most folks, but my wife and I like to cook thus we choose to stay in Airbnb's often instead of hotels.
Overall though it was a positive experience!

name: Norene
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Great stay at this condo. Balcony had great view of beach lagoon and coast of beach. Walking distance to beach. Has a pool on site. We utilized the cabana area for a get together next to the pool, we used to grill and bbq’d. The area had a sink and restrooms with tables and chairs for our guests. Was a perfect setup outside of the condo. We rented a gold cart right down the street. Scott quickly responded when we had any questions or concerns. Kitchen has all the items needed for successful cooking. Restrooms were spacious and both had double sinks. Xbox in living room. All TVs were smart or had a Roku. Beds were comfortable. My kids enjoyed the bunk beds as the bottom was about a full and the top was a twin, setup with a desk. Had all the needs to for beach..cooler, chairs, boogie boards. All in all this was a great stay for our getaway. Would definitely stay again.

Group trip
review_text: We had a fantastic stay in Scott's condo! Everything was very clean, there were plenty of towels, linens, etc. kitchen was very well stocked with tools; beautiful view; nice quiet family environment; walk to the beach was great; there is an XBox which my kids loved; 3rd floor was nice because there was nobody above us to make noise and the view was nice. Closet stocked with Sand toys, boogie boards, beach chairs, canopy - everything you need for a day at the beach. We had a fantastic time - Scott is a wonderful host - very responsive and helpful - we can't wait for our next visit!

review_text: We loved our stay! Our kids did surf camp and were able to walk to the beach every day (it has a private walkway to the beach). The pool was great too and never overly crowded. It had a lot more amenities than we were expecting (beach chairs, towels, canopy, boogie boards) and we loved having a washer/dryer. It was comfortable for our family of 6, but I would recommend more for 5 people as the pull out couch took up quite a bit of the living room. Scott was extremely responsive and also checked in regularly just to make sure we were doing good. Beautiful sunsets as well! Really enjoyed our time!

review_text: The Airbnb is in a great location. Close to the beach but also very quite and peaceful (during the days we visited). Scott was very helpful and provided all the necessary information we needed for our stay. My family and I had a great time and will definitely consider on coming back soon!

name: Alta
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
My husband & I along with our 3 children had a great experience staying here.
The condo exceeded our expectations. It was beautiful, clean & very close to the pool. We felt right at home. Scott & Autumn even provide beach chairs, toys, & 2 boogie boards so less items you have to pack. It’s very close to multiple restaurants & convenient stores. (HardKnocks Sports Bar & Grill was our favorite.)
It’s walking distance to the beach, but since driving/parking on the beach is allowed with a beach permit we chose to do that instead. This beach is probably the nicest beach that we have been to in Texas. It was very clean and has lifeguards on duty most of the day.
We highly recommend Scott & Autumn’s condo.
Thanks so much for helping us make a lot of fun memories!!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
It was a great place to stay. Is very clean, the rooms are big and the bathroom very clean. The kitchen was excellent, great space for cooking, and the living room is great to relax and enjoy a peaceful time. Excellent washer and dryer. It is only 10-12 minutes walk from the rental to Chistus Spohn Hospital. So if you have family or friends that are in the hospital and you plan on spending a few days visiting them. The home is a perfect place to stay.
The only two things that I would suggest to Christopher (Host) would be to update the bed frames or the beds.
The second thing would be to add a place in The bathroom to hang the towels and a place to put the toiletries. There is not enough around the sink.
Excellent house, I would stay there again.

It was clean, clutter free, I honestly didn't want to leave. This will be my go to place next time I go back to Corpus Christi. I HIGHLY recommend this place. It's perfect and the views are beautiful. It's also a quick walk to the beach. Area was peaceful, quiet and safe.

My bedroom and bathroom were immaculate. They also provided a parking spot in their driveway for my rental, a tiled surface table/stool for outdoor use . My stay there was not 5 stars, more like ten. I felt more at home there then at my own apartment. Incidently , along with the furnishing were a large screen tv and small refrig. my stay there was the best. I thanked them with great gratitude and told them how fortunate I was to have met them.

name: Katie

Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Maria’s place seriously deserves ten stars. First, she reached out before our stay and was very friendly and welcoming. When we arrived, we got confused as there is a similar-style building nearby with the same address number and similar looking pool area. When we reached out to Maria, she contacted us right away and made sure we got in (to the right place :)). The place itself was very clean and welcoming, with lots of space. Our kids loved the bunk beds and the pool area. We went to the pool probably 3-4 times during our two-day stay. The rental and the pool area are very kid-friendly. The beach is only a few minutes walk away. The area was very quiet. Over the course of our stay, it felt like everything was very well thought out - this place has everything you might need. There are some great restaurants within minutes away. There are countless places to stay in this area and I’m so happy I came across Maria’s listing. We would definitely stay again!

There are more cameras on the WiFi than the host lists. One in the tree by the front area, one on the front door keypad , one on the front walkway and another keypad with camera on the garage door and maybe one facing the parking. If the host is so worried about security when they live locally then I wouldn’t feel safe returning. We have been visiting the island for 18 years and I’ve never seen so many cameras on one front entry way!

review_text: This was a great place to stay for a weekend getaway. Really nice condo with a great deck and balcony for enjoying the outdoors. Very relaxing, quite place with little traffic. The place was exceptionality clean and very comfortable. Large TV's and great décor make this condo feel like home. The master bed was heavenly to sleep in. The kitchen had everything we needed to cook and the grill right out the back door was a plus to cook our fresh seafood and steaks. The Kayak and paddle boards were a great bonus to toddle around the bay and take in the scenery. Great location close to shops, grocery, and the beach. Easy to find and entry was a breeze. Nate was very proactive and informative before arrival and was available if needed during our stay but left us alone to enjoy which is always a plus. I give this condo an A+ and would recommend to anyone wanting a peaceful getaway. Thank You Nate.

Stayed one night
review_text:
Our stay at Leticia's place was nothing short of exceptional. The attention to detail was evident in every aspect of the accommodation. The linens were fresh and clean. The bathroom sparkled, and even the kitchen was spotless and inviting.
Beyond the cleanliness, the home itself was cozy and inviting, making us feel right at home from the moment we arrived. The decor was tasteful and thoughtfully curated, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere that added to the overall comfort of our stay.
In addition to the home, we were also impressed by Leticia's attention to detail and hospitality. She provided clear and timely communication throughout the booking process and was readily available to address any questions or concerns we had during our stay.
Overall, our experience at Leticia's place surpassed our expectations in every way. If you're looking for a clean, comfortable, and inviting retreat for your next getaway, look no further. We can't wait to return!

review_text: One of the best places I've stayed over many years of traveling. Sparkling clean, super comfortable, safe and welcoming. The bed and linens are fresh and very comfortable, the decor is uncluttered and warm, and the space is feels spacious. Every detail is nicely thought out. The little office area in back can be used as a walk-in closet, the bathroom is well laid-out, and the kitchen very workable--no stove but the induction hot plate works well, and the kitchen is stocked with everything you might need, all in very good shape. Leticia is very welcoming while still giving you privacy, and responds immediately to any questions. Very friendly and warm! The entire yard is fenced, and though the neighborhood is very nice and very quiet, it adds another layer of privacy and safety. Awesome place!

Even the neighborhood Cats were friendly. We listed this as our favorite and will be returning soon!

I had a great time staying at Ms. Julia’s Airbnb! Her instructions of the key location was on point! After walking inside to the studio, it was elegant. The bed was super cozy, I passed out for a couple of hours. My boyfriend had to wake me up a few times. I didn’t want to get out of the bed 🥹. The kitchen had a full size refrigerator and microwave. They do have an electric stovetop that you can use. There are utensils, i.e forks, spoons and cookware, also plates and mugs if you want some coffee. Ms. Julia also provided some snacks on the counters. The bathroom was pretty nice. The tub was deep and roomy for those who has long legs. My boyfriend did take a bath and enjoyed it for his back. There’s a stripe gas station about a mile out and there’s a bridge where you can see the sunrise and it is amazing.
Ms. Julia does provide an instruction and guidelines, not only to the studio, but where is the nearest restaurant, stores, etc . I do recommend this place! Mahalo

If I could give Julia's place 10 stars, I would! Exactly as the photos, immaculately clean, bed is like heaven. I didn't do any cooking, but there's adequate supplies if you want to. I had one small need which was addressed immediately and rectified before I was back for the day. The area is quiet, easy to find, and (for me) only about a mile from my daughter's house! It was a wonderful, peaceful place to come back to after a long day. Snacks were a very nice bonus as well! And the soaking tub...pure relaxation!
They have thoughtfully places a dehumidifier in the bathroom, since the location is right on the laguna. If you would like to have a less humid environment inside, it's a good idea to empty the water out daily. It shuts off when it's full. I didn't mind at all, as it was a nice feature.
Everything about this studio emanates thought and intention. I will definitely be back!

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
What a wonderful place! We checked in and found cold sodas and water in the fridge and the biggest TV that we've ever had the pleasure to watch! The linens were wonderful and soft and the little extras were exceptional. I loved the makeup remover wipes and the spa supplies in the bath. My husband appreciated the coffee and small things like the spices and salt and pepper. Lots of things were there that we forgot to pack, so it made our stay so easy. Also, we enjoyed the snack basket that Julia left us!
The neighborhood is super quiet, on a dead end and very close to a launch if you have a boat.
We visited Mustang Island State Park (about 10 minutes or so) and it was perfect for us. There were very few people there and our dog was welcome too! Not many shells, but soft white sand and porta potties galore! They had covered picnic tables and trash cans all along the beach. The best part was, we could drive our car and park almost next to the waves!
We would recommend this sweet place to anyone who is looking for a wonderful vacay at the beach. ⛱️🐾🏖️

All in all great price and great stay!

review_text: Not only was finding the location easy (considering the greeters) but, David was responsive and friendly. The Dawg House is very cozy, and perfect for a weekend getaway. The building was so rustic that it almost makes you forget you are right next to the beach. From the decorations to how perfectly the doors open, it is obvious a lot of care was put into the Dawg House. We will absolutley make sure to come back when the weather is warmer and we would be able to use the pool and firepit. Unfortunately the werent able to use the firepit or pool due to the freezing winds of nature.
